hypothesis_content.title: Positive Catalyst Fade in Stress Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, positive news catalysts (sentiment > +0.7) trigger brief 1-hour rallies (>2%) that fail completely within 3 hours, returning to or below pre-news levels, as selling pressure overwhelms any bullish sentiment amid negative market structure.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In stress regimes, market participants are primed to sell into strength. Positive news creates a liquidity event for trapped longs and short-term speculators to exit. Negative funding rates and lack of OI expansion signal weak conviction behind the rally, making it a 'dead cat bounce' scenario.
entry_conditions: Funding rates remain negative or turn less negative by < 0.001%
Open Interest increases by < 5% during the rally (weak conviction)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to pre-news catalyst level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price rallies another 1.5% above entry high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such positive-news rallies in stress regimes sustain above pre-news levels for over 3 hours.
